post: #OTD in 1777, the Continental Congress adopted the "Stars and Stripes" as the national flag of the United States of America. Today, we celebrate that this banner has flown for nearly 250 years. The next time you need an American flag (or any flag for that matter!) remember that Federal Flags, LLC gives back to BRI when you use the code 'BRI' at check-out.  https://bit.ly/3z2vhMW

#OTD in 1775, the Second Continental Congress established the Continental Army. Today, we encourage you to discover the inspiring story of Joseph Plumb Martin, a young patriot who joined the Continental Army at just 15 years old. His memoir, "A Narrative of Some of the Adventures, Dangers, and Sufferings of a Revolutionary Soldier," offers a powerful glimpse into the courage and sacrifice of those who fought for our nation's independence.  https://bit.ly/44fb6bJ  #BillofRightsInstitute  #AmericanRevolution  #PrimarySource

The road to American independence was long and bloody. Our latest A250 Mini Documentary examines the Battle of Bunker Hill, a turning point that showed the true cost of liberty. Join us as we trace the events of that fateful day and its impact on the broader struggle for freedom.  https://bit.ly/4dXDd2q  #AmericanHistory  #A250  #BattleofBunkerHill

Students gathered at Oklahoma State Universitys Tulsa campus last week to make their pitch for funding as part of the Bill of Rights Institutes MyImpact Challenge Civics Fair. Inspired by Tulsas rich history of diverse entrepreneurship, BRI collaborated with Kidvation Global and Tulsa Changemakers for the event, which consisted of students taking part in a hack-a-thon  session. They worked to develop a solution to a problem in their local communities and made a pitch  for funding that same day, while using the constitutional principles central to the contest. Read our latest blog for more!  https://lnkd.in/evrpz34W

Today, we recognize The LD Expert Stephanie Tsapakis, M. A., WDT and Chelsea DiMarzio, M. A. CCC-SLP, WDP as a Civics for Everyone Heroesbecause they dont just support students with learning differences, they amplify them.  https://www.ldexpert.org/ In a world where too many learners are underestimated or overlooked, The LD Expert is giving students the tools - and the belief - to step forward, speak up, and lead. Using their expertise in learning disabilities, they work to empower students with strategies for comprehension and communication and have a deep commitment to making civic learning truly accessible. Their services ensure that students with learning differences receive the necessary support to actively engage in civic education by enhancing their communication skills, reading abilities, and participation in classroom discussions. Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Brianna Blair! Brianna is a high school junior from Goodyear, Arizona. She is very excited to be a BRI Student Fellow! With a passion for civic education, she believes in increasing representation in government and politics. She founded a youth organization, HerGov, to increase the number of young women entering the public policy sphere. Learn more about BRI's Student Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Interested in learning about our approach to teaching civics? Chief Program Officer Stan Swim explores how we seek to teach it in a way that is effective, unique, and relevant to students and educators today. Instead of focusing solely on the structure and function of government, BRI teaches young people to engage in the institutions of civil society, like businesses, charities, and community groups, to solve problems and pursue opportunities.
